com.informatics.lehigh.cardboardarlibrary

Class CameraTextureRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.informatics.lehigh.cardboardarlibrary.CameraTextureRenderer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GLRenderer

    public class CameraTextureRenderer
extends java.lang.Object
implements GLRenderer
    Renderer for drawing the camera feed on a SurfaceTexture (GL_TEXTURE_EXTERNAL_OES) to a normal Texture2D.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CameraTextureRenderer(android.app.Activity activity)

      void init()
      Initialize all GL elements of the renderer like buffers, textures, and shaders.
      void setCameraSurfaceTexture(android.graphics.SurfaceTexture surfaceTexture)
      Sets the surface texture to update in order to get the most recent camera frame while rendering.
      void update(com.google.vr.sdk.base.HeadTransform headTransform)
      Updates the GL elements of the renderer like vertex buffers and model matrices.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CameraTextureRenderer

        public CameraTextureRenderer(android.app.Activity activity)

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Initialize all GL elements of the renderer like buffers, textures, and shaders. Should be called from onSurfaceCreated().
        Specified by:
        init in interface GLRenderer

      • update

        public void update(com.google.vr.sdk.base.HeadTransform headTransform)
        Updates the GL elements of the renderer like vertex buffers and model matrices. These things are independent of any single view and is meant to be called once per frame. Should be called from onNewFrame().
        Specified by:
        update in interface GLRenderer
        Parameters:
        headTransform - Contains the up, right, and forward vectors of the cardboard viewer needed for calculations.

      • draw

        public void draw(float[] view,
                 float[] perspective)
        Draws the GL elements defined by this renderer. This should be called from onDrawEye().
        Specified by:
        draw in interface GLRenderer
        Parameters:
        view - The 4x4 view matrix to use for rendering.
        perspective - The 4x4 projection matrix to user for rendering.

      • getCameraTexture

        public int getCameraTexture()
        Returns:
        the ID of the texture that the camera feed should be drawn to using a SurfaceTexture.

      • setCameraSurfaceTexture

        public void setCameraSurfaceTexture(android.graphics.SurfaceTexture surfaceTexture)
        Sets the surface texture to update in order to get the most recent camera frame while rendering.
        Parameters:
        surfaceTexture -
